metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27223 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In drivers/usb/gadget/udc/udc-xilinx.c in the Linux kernel before 5.16.12,the endpoint index is not validated and might be manipulated by the hostfor out-of-array access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-generic - 4.4.0-224.257
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-224-lowlatency - 4.4.0-224.257
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1105-kvm - 4.4.0-1105.114
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1140-aws - 4.4.0-1140.154
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1128-aws - 4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-gcp - 4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-oracle - 4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-224.257').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1105.114').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.154').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
